org.svvrl.goal.core.logic.ltl

Class LTLUnifier

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.svvrl.goal.core.logic.LogicUnifier<LTL>
      • org.svvrl.goal.core.logic.ltl.LTLUnifier

  • public class LTLUnifier
extends LogicUnifier<LTL>
    An LTLUnifier can perform unification on two LTL formulae: source and target. If the unification succeeds (the source and the target are equal up to proposition substitution), then there exists a proposition substitution for the source such that the substituted source is equal to the target.
    Author:
    Ming-Hsien Tsai

    • Constructor Detail

      • LTLUnifier

        public LTLUnifier()
        Constructs this unifier. By default, a proposition may be mapped by more than one proposition in the returned substitution of unification for lunify(LTL, LTL), lunifyStr(LTL, LTL), punify(LTL, LTL), and punifyStr(LTL, LTL)

      • LTLUnifier

        public LTLUnifier(boolean one_to_one)
        Constructs this unifier.
        Parameters:
        one_to_one - indicating if a proposition can be mapped by only one proposition in the returned substitution of unification for lunify(LTL, LTL), lunifyStr(LTL, LTL), punify(LTL, LTL), and punifyStr(LTL, LTL)

    • Method Detail

      • unify

        public java.util.Map<Proposition,LTL> unify(LTL source,
                                            LTL target)
                                     throws UnificationException
        Description copied from class: LogicUnifier
        Performs unification on two formulae: source and target, and returns a proposition substitution for source such that the substituted source is equal to target.
        Specified by:
        unify in class LogicUnifier<LTL>
        Parameters:
        source - a formula
        target - a formula
        Returns:
        a proposition substitution that renames propositions in source such that the renamed source is equal to target
        Throws:
        UnificationException - if the unification fails

      • lunify

        public java.util.Map<Proposition,LTL> lunify(LTL source,
                                             LTL target)
                                      throws UnificationException
        Unifies two formulae up to literal renaming.
        Parameters:
        source - an LTL formula
        target - an LTL formula
        Returns:
        a proposition substitution that renames propositions in source such that the renamed source is equal to target
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if source or target contains a sub-formula which is a conjunction or disjunction of more than 16 formulae
        UnificationException - if the unification fails
